description: A technique used in desert regions to capture and store rainwater, enhancing soil moisture and supporting crop cultivation.
principles: Utilizes natural rainfall to recharge soil moisture
Promotes sustainable agriculture in arid climates
Reduces dependency on pumps and external water sources
steps: Identify suitable land slopes for water collection.
Construct barriers to direct rainwater flow.
Create channels to spread water across agricultural land.
Monitor soil moisture levels to assess effectiveness.
risks: Ineffective water capture during low rainfall years
Soil erosion if barriers are not properly maintained
Potential for water stagnation leading to pests
